conclusion: Understanding v-t graph and displacement concept.
Calculate total displacement from t=0 to t=3 seconds to check if it's zero.
From t=0 to t=1 second, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
Displacement for t=0 to t=1 second is 2 meters.
From t=1 to t=2 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
Displacement for t=1 to t=2 seconds is 1 meter.
Total displacement at t=2 seconds is 3 meters.
From t=2 to t=3 seconds, velocity decreases to -2 m/s.
Displacement for t=2 to t=3 seconds is -1 meter.
Total displacement at t=3 seconds is 2 meters.
Particle is 2 meters ahead at t=3 seconds, not back to starting point.
Rechecking calculations confirms total displacement is 2 meters.
Consider displacement as a vector; still results in 2 meters ahead.
